emissions.closest_match_explanation: The ingredient '1 small onion' is best matched with 'onion, raw' because it is the least processed option available, aligning with rule 4. 'Red onion' and 'onions, spring, raw' are also raw but 'onion, raw' is a more general category. 'Onions, chopped and deepfried' is more processed.

The ingredient '2 cloves of garlic' is best matched with 'garlic, raw' because it is the least processed option available, aligning with rule 4. 'Garlic in oil' and 'garlic baguette, frozen' are more processed. 'Red onion' is not a garlic product.

The ingredient '0.5 Red pepper' is best matched with 'pepper, sweet, red, raw' because it is the least processed option available, aligning with rule 4. 'Pepper, hot chili, raw' is a different type of pepper. 'Pepper, hot chili, canned' is processed. 'Pepper, black' is a spice and not a fresh pepper.

The ingredient 'oil' is a general term. Among the available options, 'sunflower oil' and 'oil for frying' have the same emission factor. According to rule 5, when multiple viable options have similar processing levels, the one with the highest emission factor should be chosen. However, in this case, 'olive oil' has a higher emission factor (5.9 kg CO2e/kg) and is a common type of oil, making it a suitable conservative choice.

The ingredient '250 g of beef' is best matched with 'average beef' as it is the most general and least processed option for beef, aligning with rule 2 and 4. Other options specify cuts or fat content, making 'average beef' the most appropriate broader category.

The ingredient '1.5 tablespoons fajita crawling' does not have a direct match in the emission database. The available options like 'taco shells', 'salsa, hot', 'crayfish, raw', and 'tortilla chips, cheese' are not suitable broader categories or synonyms for 'fajita crawling' (which likely refers to a spice mix or seasoning), violating rule 1 and 2. Therefore, no suitable match can be found.

The ingredient 'chili powder or flakes' is best matched with 'curry powder' as a broader category for a spice blend, aligning with rule 2. While 'pepper, hot chili, raw' and 'pepper, hot chili, canned' are related to chili, they are not in powder or flake form. 'Chili sauce' is a processed product and not a powder/flake.

The ingredient '1 can of kidney beans' is best matched with 'kidney beans' as it is an exact match for the primary ingredient and processing (canned is implied by 'can'), aligning with rule 4. 'Black beans' are a different type of bean. 'Beans, baked in tomato sauce, canned' is a more processed product. 'Beans, green, raw' is a different type of bean and is raw.

The ingredient '2 tablespoons tomato puree' is best matched with 'tomato paste, concentrated' as tomato puree is a concentrated form of tomato, similar to tomato paste, aligning with rule 4. 'Tomato, peeled, canned' and 'tomatojuice, canned' are less concentrated forms. 'Tomato, dried' is a different processing method.

The ingredient '2.5 dl beef fund/broth' is best matched with 'bouillon, beef, prepared' as it represents a prepared liquid form of beef broth, aligning with rule 4. 'Bouillon, beef, concentrated, cube' is a more concentrated form. 'Beef, low fat' and 'beef, mince, 15-20% fat, raw' are raw meat products, not broth.

The ingredient '11 small cornstortillas' is best matched with 'tortilla bread, wheat' as a broader category for tortillas, aligning with rule 2. While 'taco shells' and 'tortilla chips, cheese' are related, 'tortilla bread, wheat' is a more general and less processed form of tortilla. 'Corn flour' is an ingredient, not a finished tortilla.

The ingredient '1 serving of tomato salsa' is best matched with 'salsa, hot' as it is a direct match for the ingredient, aligning with rule 4. 'Sundried tomatoes', 'tomato, dried', and 'tomato, peeled, canned' are ingredients of salsa, not the finished product.

The ingredient '1 Avocado' is best matched with 'avocado, raw' as it is an exact and least processed match, aligning with rule 4. 'Olive oil', 'mayonnaise', and 'aubergine, raw' are not suitable matches for avocado.

The ingredient '0.5 Red onion' is best matched with 'red onion' as it is an exact and least processed match, aligning with rule 4. 'Onion, raw' is a general category but 'red onion' is more specific. 'Onions, spring, raw' is a different type of onion. 'Onions, chopped and deepfried' is more processed.

The ingredient '2 cloves of garlic' is best matched with 'garlic, raw' because it is the least processed option available, aligning with rule 4. 'Garlic in oil' and 'garlic baguette, frozen' are more processed. 'Red onion' is not a garlic product.

The ingredient '300 g of tomatoes' is best matched with 'tomato, peeled, canned' as it is a common processed form of tomatoes and has a lower emission factor than dried tomatoes, aligning with rule 4 and 5. 'Tomato, dried' and 'sundried tomatoes' are more processed. 'Tomatojuice, canned' is a different product.

The ingredient '0.75 chili pepper' is best matched with 'pepper, hot chili, raw' as it is the least processed option available, aligning with rule 4. 'Pepper, hot chili, canned' is processed. 'Chili sauce' is a processed product. 'Pepper, black' is a different type of spice.

The ingredient '0.5 Bdt coriander' does not have a direct match in the emission database. 'Curry powder' is a spice blend but not specifically coriander. 'Basil, dried' and 'basil, fresh' are different herbs. 'Dill, raw' is also a different herb. Therefore, no suitable match can be found.

The ingredient '2 tablespoons olive oil' is best matched with 'olive oil' as it is an exact match and the least processed option among the oil choices, aligning with rule 4. 'Olive tapenade' and 'garlic in oil' are processed products. 'Sunflower oil' is a different type of oil.

The ingredient 'The juice of 0.5 lime' is best matched with 'lime, raw' as it is the direct source of the juice and the least processed option, aligning with rule 4. 'Lemon, raw' is a different citrus fruit. 'Apple juice' and 'half pears in juice' are different fruit juices.
